parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A broken rear axle leaf spring can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Broken leaf spring
uneven ride
loss of vehicle stability.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A shimmy or vibration in the chassis can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Shimmy or vibration in the chassis
especially between 40-45 mph
loss of vehicle stability
fear of losing control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Suspension problems can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Uneven ride
loss of vehicle stability
vibration or shimmy in the chassis.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Cracked hoses and fluid leaks can cause engine damage, overheating, and potentially lead to engine failure, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Cracked hoses
fluid leaking from the engine
engine noise or vibration.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty exhaust manifold can cause noise, vibration, and potentially lead to engine damage or failure, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Noise coming from the exhaust manifold
vibration
rust or corrosion on the manifold.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure to repair or replace the EGR valve can cause engine performance issues, decreased fuel efficiency, and potentially lead to engine damage or failure.
symptoms: Difficulty getting recall work done due to parts unavailability
engine performance issues.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the automatic parking brake can cause the vehicle to roll or move unexpectedly, which can lead to accidents, injuries, or property damage.
symptoms: The vehicle rolls or moves after being put in park
the parking brake fails to engage
the parking brake engages unexpectedly while driving
the parking brake handle jumps out of the driver's hand
the parking brake shoes are glazed and out of adjustment.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the parking brake cable can cause the parking brake to malfunction, leading to unexpected vehicle movement or accidents.
symptoms: The parking brake cable is damaged or faulty
the parking brake fails to engage
the parking brake handle is difficult to operate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the parking brake shoes can cause the parking brake to malfunction, leading to unexpected vehicle movement or accidents.
symptoms: The parking brake shoes are glazed and out of adjustment
the parking brake fails to engage
the parking brake handle is difficult to operate.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Brake Line Design and Routing Issue
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The poor design and routing of the brake line can cause the brake line to melt or seize, leading to a loss of brake function, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle's brakes seize or stick
the brake pedal feels hard or spongy
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake caliper can cause the brakes to stick or seize, leading to a loss of brake function, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The brakes stick or seize
the brake pedal feels hard or spongy
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The corrosion of the hydraulic lines can cause a loss of brake function, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The brakes feel spongy or soft
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake master cylinder can cause a loss of brake function, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels hard or spongy
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual
the brake fluid boils
causing an extended stopping distance.
